It is important to understand section 32(1) of the Evidence Ordinance. It states thus;
32(1)   When the statement is made by a person as to the cause of his death, or as to any
of  the  circumstances  of  the  transaction  which  resulted  in  his  death,  in  cases  in
which the cause of that person's death comes into question. Such statements are
relevant  whether  the  person  who  made  them  was  or  was  not,  at  the  time  when
they were made, under the expectation of death, and whatever may be the nature
of the proceedings in which the cause of his death comes into question.
